qas.question: When was green associated with the romantic movement in literature and art?
Who was a French philospher that celebrated the virtues of nature?
Which German poet and philospher declared green to be the most restful color?
What philosopher began the industrial Revolution?
What did Goethe call the color gray?
Who painted scenes depicting the Industrial Revolution?

context: In the <a0_0>18th and 19th century<a0_0/>, green was associated with the romantic movement in literature and art. The French philosopher <a1_0><b4_0>Jean-Jacques Rousseau<b4_0/><a1_0/> celebrated the virtues of nature, The <b3_0>German<b3_0/> poet and philosopher <a2_0><b7_0>Goethe<b7_0/><a2_0/> declared that green was <b5_0>the most restful color<b5_0/>, suitable for decorating bedrooms. Painters such as John Constable and <b6_0>Jean-Baptiste-Camille Corot<b6_0/> depicted the lush green of rural landscapes and forests. Green was contrasted to the smoky grays and blacks of the Industrial Revolution.
